intro: Cyanothamnus baeckeaceus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bluebells, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Cyanothamnus baeckeaceus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands.
